Detailed Description

The main interface widget.

There is only one of these widgets in the application, which is created and owned by DzApp.

It can be accessed by requesting a pointer to it from DzApp via DzApp::getInterface().

Member Function Documentation

DzMainWindow::aboutToClose (  )  [signal]

Emitted just before the main window closes.

void DzMainWindow::addShutDownCheck ( DzShutDownCheck *  check  ) 

Adds a test to the list of conditions that are checked before the interface closes. This is usefull for prompting the user to save changes before the application closes, etc.

Parameters:
check A pointer to a check condition to add to the list. The main window takes ownership of this object and will delete it after the interface has closed.
DzMainWindow::alwaysOnTopChanged ( bool  onOff  )  [signal]

Emitted when the main window is switched to/from being always on top.

bool DzMainWindow::askSaveChanges (  )  [slot]

Presents the user with a dialog that asks if they want to save changes to the scene, and does a scene save if the user selects yes.

Returns:
False if the user selects 'Cancel', true if the user selects 'Yes' or 'No'.
bool DzMainWindow::askTurnOffLimits (  )  [slot]

Presents the user with a dialog that asks if they want to turn off limits to apply the preset currently being loaded.

Returns:
true if limits should be turned off - false if limits should be left alone.
bool DzMainWindow::checkExistingFile ( const QString &  name  )  [slot]

Checks to see if the given file already exists - if it does, prompts the user if they want to overwrite it.

Parameters:
name The name of the file to look for.
Returns:
true if the file does not exist or the user wants to overwrite it - false if the user needs to select a new name.
void DzMainWindow::clearUIPopUp (  )  [slot]

Clears a the current UI popup if there is one.

Called when a close event needs to be processed by the main window

void DzMainWindow::displayPrompt ( const QString &  line,
int  ms = -1 
) [slot]

Display a message in the status bar.

Parameters:
line Message to display
ms If greater than zero, the message will be displayed for the given amount of time, otherwise the message will be displayed until another message is sent.

const QString &  title,

QString &  filename,
int *  selectedFilter = NULL,
QWidget *  parent = 0 
) [slot]

Display a dialog for the user to choose a file

Parameters:
selectedFilter If not NULL, its value is set to the index of the filter that corresponds to the selected file.
parent The parent widget for the file dialog
open If true displays an open file dialog, otherwise displays a save file dialog.
title Title of the dialog box
startsWith Starting directory (can include a default file name)
fileFilter List of file types that can be selected.
filename Return value for filename
Returns:
true if the user selects a file, False if the user cancels.

bool DzMainWindow::doGeometryImport ( DzShape **  shape,
QWidget *  parent = 0 
) [slot]

Displays a dialog for loading a non-native geometry file, and loads the file into a shape instance of the appropriate type. The shape pointer will then be set to point to the newly created shape.

Returns:
true if a file was selected and successfully loaded, otherwise false.

void DzMainWindow::ensureWindowOnScreen ( QWidget *  widget  )  [static]

This method makes sure that the given widget is fully on the screen. If any part of it is off-screen, it will be moved so that it is fully on-screen. The widget should be a top-level window.

Parameters:
widget The widget to check for being on-screen. This should be a top-level window.

) [virtual]

void DzMainWindow::restoreUILockState (  )  [slot]

void DzMainWindow::restoreWindowGeometryState ( QWidget *  widget  )  [static]

This method restores the given widget's geometry state (size, position) from a previously stored state. It also makes sure that the window is fully on the screen. The widget should be a top-level window, and it should have a unique name (as set in the constructor or using QObject::setObjectName()).

Parameters:
widget The widget whose geometry state will be restored. This should be a top-level window with a unique name.
See also:
saveWindowGeometryState(), ensureWindowOnScreen()
void DzMainWindow::saveWindowGeometryState ( QWidget *  widget  )  [static]

This method saves the given widget's geometry state (size, position) so that the next time the widget is shown it can be restored to the state it was in previously. The widget should be a top-level window, and it should have a unique name (as set in the constructor or using QObject::setObjectName()).

Parameters:
widget The widget whose geometry state will be saved. This should be a top-level window with a unique name.
See also:
restoreWindowGeometryState()
void DzMainWindow::setAlwaysOnTop ( bool  onOff  ) 

Sets whether the main window is always above other windows

Note:

DzUIPopUpWgt * DzMainWindow::toggleUIPopUpWgt ( const QString &  filename,
QWidget *  posWgt = NULL 
) [slot]
Returns:
The DzUIPopUpWgt that was created. If it was toggled off, then it returns null

If a popup already exists with the same filename, it is cleared (toggled). Otherwise it has the same effect as calling DzMainWindow::showUIPopUpWgt()

Parameters:
filename The script that loads a .ui, or a .ui, file to show in the UIPopUpWgt.
posWgt The widget to position the popup on.
DzMainWindow::uiLockedChanged (  )  [signal]

Returns:
True if tool tips are enabled, false otherwise.
